tool.name: Libshuff
tool.description: Cramer-von Mises tests communities for the same structure
tool.command: mothur_wrapper.py --cmd='libshuff' --result='^mothur.\S+\.logfile$:'$logfile,'^\S+\.libshuff\.summary$:'$summary,'^\S+\.libshuff\.coverage$:'$coverage --outputdir='$logfile.extra_files_path' --phylip="$dist" --group="$group" #if $groups.__str__ != "None" and len($groups.__str__) > 0: --groups="$groups" #end if #if len($iters.__str__) > 0: --iters="$iters" #end if "$sim" #if $form == "discrete": #if 1.0 >= float($form.step.__str__) > 0.0: --step="$form.step" #end if #if 1.0 >= float($cutoff.__str__) > 0.0: --cutoff="$form.cutoff" #end if #end if

param.name: iters
param.label: iters - Number of iterations to try (default 10000)

param.name: sim
param.label: sim - Matrix values are Similary instead of Distance

param.name: step
param.label: step - Step size - ignored if not > 0
param.help: default value 0.10, smaller steps approach integral

param.name: cutoff
param.label: cutoff - Cutoff threshold - ignored if not > 0

tool.help:
@MOTHUR_OVERVIEW@
**Command Documenation**
The libshuff_ method is a generic test that describes whether two or more communities have the same structure using the Cramer-von Mises test statistic. The significance of the test statistic indicates the probability that the communities have the same structure by chance. Because each pairwise comparison requires two significance tests, a correction for multiple comparisons (e.g. Bonferroni's correction) must be applied.
.. _libshuff: http://www.mothur.org/wiki/Libshuff
